name.text: Don Giovanni by Venture Opera - Sunday, Nov. 8
name.html: Don Giovanni by Venture Opera - Sunday, Nov. 8

description.text:
Venture Opera presents Don Giovanni 
November 6, 8, 10, 2015 
  
Our installation of Mozart and da Ponte's Don Giovanni casts the serial seducer as a Catholic priest who has abused the power of his office to satisfy his insatiable desires. Set in the Angel Orensanz Center, one of the oldest surviving gothic-revival sacred spaces in New York, Edwin Cahill's immersive production, with costumes by Project Runway season 12 finalist, Bradon McDonald, and lights designed by Yael Lubetzky, begins where Don Giovanni's story must end: souls living out their eternal judgment. 
The ghosts of Don Giovanni, his victims, and his enemies are brought to life by Ryan McAdams, leading a chamber orchestra, and Philip Cutlip, starring as the corrupt pastor, whose story's end catapults the audience from the purgatory of souls into an after-party celebrating the triumph of the light of truth. 
  
The bar opens aprroximately one hour before showtime. Each ticket holder is invited to enjoy the performance and that night's after party. DJ to be announced. 
  
Conducted by Ryan McAdams, Directed by Edwin Cahill 
Featuring: 




 
Philip Cutlip (Don Giovanni) 


 
Eric Downs (Leporello) 




 
Christian Zaremba (Il Commendatore) 


 
Amy Shoremount-Obra (Donna Anna) 




 
Yujoong Kim (Don Ottavio) 


 
Marquita Raley (Donna Elvira) 




 
Matthew Patrick Morris (Masetto) 


 
Cecelia Hall (Zerlina) 




  
Music by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, Italian libretto by Lorenzo Da Ponte. Supertitles will be provided in English. Run Time: Approximately 2.5 hours with one 15 minute intermission. 
For a complete synopsis please visit www.ventureopera.com. 
 
  
FAQs 
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
This event is 18+. 
How do I choose my seat?  
Seats at the Angel Orensanz Foundation will be available on a first-come, first-serve basis in your chosen section. We recommend getting to the venue as doors open for the best selection. 
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
By Subway: Take the F Line to 2nd Avenue or the B, D, F, M, J, Z Lines to Delancey Street/Essex Street. 
By Car: The event is located on Norfolk Street between East Houston Street and Stanton Street. There is an Edison ParkFast structure at 167 Essex Street, one block from the venue. 
Is my ticket transferrable? 
Tickets are non-transferable and non-refundable. The ticket purchaser must present valid photo ID for entry to the show. 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No. Just bring a valid photo ID and we will see you at the show!  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Please email tickets@ventureopera.com if you have any questions.

name.text: brunchwork w/ Minibar & Thought Catalog
name.html: brunchwork w/ Minibar & Thought Catalog

description.text:
Grab the last spots for an unforgettable brunch and mimosas with Lara Crystal (Minibar Delivery cofounder) and Alex Magnin (Thought Catalog partner & CRO).    
 
* Build connections with other young people hungry for the next opportunity (we will introduce you to the people you want to meet)  
* Fireside chat with our special guests in an intimate setting 
* Participate in interactive group challenge 
* Learn what it takes to build a successful company 
  
About the speakers 
 
Lara Crystal is the Cofounder of Minibar Delivery, which provides on-demand delivery of wine, spirits, beer & mixers. Minibar raised a total of $1.8 million in seed funding and operates in more than 12 cities nationwide. 
Lara spent many years working in fashion for brands like Coach, Chanel, and Cole Haan. Ultimately, she landed as one of the first hires at Rent the Runway where she rose to VP of Marketing. Lara is a graduate of the Wharton Business School. 
* 
 
Alex Magnin is the Chief Revenue Officer and Partner of The Thought & Expression Co., publisher of the popular millenial digital magazine Thought Catalog. He  is the architect of Thought Catalog's ad sales strategy. Alex was recently named to Forbes 30 Under 30.  
Alex started his career on the founding team of Martini Media, a premium digital advertising technology and marketing services start up and served as an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at OysterLabs, a mobile marketing technology company.  
  
About the space 
 
WeWork is the platform for creators. They provide the space, community, and service you to make a life, not just a living. There has been a macro shift towards a new way of work – one focused on a movement towards meaning. WeWork is accelerating this movement. 
  
 
  
See you at brunch! Bring friends & become a VIB - more details on www.brunchwork.com!

name.text: Disney Movie Trivia
name.html: Disney Movie Trivia

description.text:
“When you wish upon a star…,” your wish for Disney Trivia comes true! 
Join us under the sea, before the stroke of midnight, in the Cave of Wonders and before the final petal falls for Disney Movie Trivia at Essex Restaurant NYC on Sunday, November 8 starting 8pm. 
Questions will focus on Disney’s classic animated films, from 1937′s Snow White to Frozen. Now’s your chance to test your knowledge and re-live all your favorite moments. 
For reservations to this event, visit; http://DisneyQuizEssex.Eventbrite.com 
The best way to reserve tickets is by selecting a team captain and having them be in charge of tickets for ALL team members. 
For example, if Mickey, Mini, Pluto and Goofy are on a team and Mini Mouse gets put in charge, she will then reserve tickets for herself, Mickey, Pluto and Goofy = (4) in total. 
PLEASE ONLY RESERVE SINGLE TICKETS IF YOU ARE PLAYING BY YOURSELF. 
We will send a confirmation email to everyone closer to the event. 
And if you don’t win, hey, Hakuna matata — it’ll be fun no matter what!

name.text: Lower East Cider Festival
name.html: Lower East Cider Festival

description.text:
How 'bout dem apples?? Come celebrate cider in the LES with 'Lower East CIDER Festival' on Sunday, November 8th from 12-4pm. As part of Cider Week NYC, and co-produced by the Lower East Side Business Improvement District, this outdoor event will showcase cider makers and apple pickers fromthe Finger Lakes, Hudson Valley, Long Island and NYC, each of which will be paired with local restaurants, serving up applicious fare. In addition to apple-themed dish and cider pairings, the event will also include culinary discussions, a community cider press, music, folk dancing, an apple pie making contest, and a DIY caramel apple booth. Lower East CIDER Festival is the official kick­off to Cider Week NYC, and is free and open to the public.  
  
Participating cidermakers and farmers include: 
Aaron Burr Cidery Bad Seed Hard Cider Black Duck Cidery Descendant Cider Doc's Draft Hard Cider Good Life Cider Harvest Moon Cidery Hudson Valley Farmhouse Cider Naked Flock Cider Nine Pin Ciderworks Orchard Hill Cider Mill Standard Cider Slyboro Cider House Wolffer Estate Vineyard Consider Bardwell Farm Breezy Hill Orchard 
Participating Restaurants: 
Wassail  Contra Mission Cantina Galli Clawdaddy's Queens Kickshaw Back Forty Northern Spy Food Co. Huertas Goodfellas Pizza

name.text: Creative Catalyst Symposium
name.html: Creative Catalyst Symposium

description.text:
Participate in Heshvan, the Jewish Social Action Month & the National Arts and Humanities Month of the Americans for the Arts through Art Kibbutz’s Conference! Get inspired with new friends: artists, performers, writers, actors, curators, community leaders, activists, scholars, students, rabbis, visionaries.   Our event connects passionate people who share similar values in their work on advancing social justice issues and making ‘tzedek’ a core expression of Jewish life through their art or community work.   Artists and creatives are at the forefront of communicating change, using artistic reflection, dialogue and idea generation. Learn from the experts, gather insights from Jewish texts, and delve into real-world scenarios that will elicit new ideas and instigate collaborations… and we’ll have a great time!  The symposium will kick off its 2016 international, inter-disciplinary arts residency on Governor's Island focusing on socially engaged art May through September. The event is dedicated to the memory of Art Kibbutz resident, Jackie Brookner. 
PROGRAM:             
9:00 – 9:30             Registration 
9:30-12:30             Workshops, Discussions & Presentations 
12:30 – 1:30            Lunch 
1:30 – 2:00            ROOTED: The Ecological Duality of Nature and Jewish Identity  Exhibition Tour   
2:00 – 4:00             Structured Activities – Interactive, Hands-on Workshops 
4:00 – 4:30            Closing Session  
Held in conjunction with Art Kibbutz’s exhibition, Rooted: The Ecological Duality of Nature and Jewish Identity also at the Manny Cantor Center on view from October 13th to December 1st. 
Registration fee: $35 – including kosher dairy lunch / $25 without lunch for artists and community organizers who are new to the Art Kibbutz community. Old timers: FREE ($10 lunch optional)

name.text: CONCERT: Eyal Vilner and The Big Band
name.html: CONCERT: Eyal Vilner and The Big Band

description.text: The Eyal Vilner Big Band stays true to its name -- it is BIG. 17 musicians big! Led by Tel Aviv-born, New York-educated musician/composer/conductor Eyal Vilner, the band has collaborated with big time jazz legends such as Jimmy Heath and Jimmy Owens. Join us and groove along as they perform Vilner’s new arrangements of jazz classics as well as his original compositions. Sponsored by Helene and Steven Walsey

name.text: Tech Show @ ChickTech: High School Kickoff
name.html: Tech Show @ ChickTech: High School Kickoff

description.text:
ChickTech NYC invites you to our first annual ChickTech: High School Tech Show! Our high school participants will have worked hard all weekend to create an awesome project in one of our workshops.  
Stop by and see what they've created! We think you'll be amazed by their creativity and progress, especially since most of our participants have never been exposed to programming or hardware before.  
Cheer them on and encourage them to keep making progress! The event is free, but please feel free to donate* so we can keep doing what we're doing! We look forward to seeing you there. 
Learn more about ChickTech: High School on our website: newyork.chicktech.org. 
*All donations are tax-deductible. Our tax ID, through our fiscal sponsor (TAO Foundation), is: 20-0072527.

name.text: Crimson Kitty Presents: LADYQUEEN! The Travel Edition!
name.html: Crimson Kitty Presents: LADYQUEEN! The Travel Edition!

description.text:
Fresh off the heels at the sold out success of the Dixon Place HOT! Festival, LadyQueen returns with a fresh batch of ladies traveling from drag parts unknown! Join us as we celebrate drag diversity as the place where pride began..STONEWALL! 
Our diverse cast of queer, femme, and feminist queens simply aim to exist in a culture that is predominately male driven and run, and offer insight into a world of drag that doesn’t require tucking. Drag isn’t just for the boys anymore! 
In addition, we will have games and a fabulous raffle sponsored by The Pleasure Chest. 
Hosted by Crimson Kitty (2015 Glam Awards Nominee,2014 Dragnet Cycle 3 Winner &  Brooklyn Nightlife Award Nominee for Drag Queen Of The Year 2015) 
Performances By: Rosemary Maybe, Madge of Honor and Elle McQueen!

name.text: FREE Coding Fair
name.html: FREE Coding Fair

description.text:
Heard a lot of buzz about coding and kids? Not sure what it is or what class your kid should be taking? Does your child love Minecraft or playing games and you want to make that time more productive?  
Come to our CODING FAIR to learn about coding - the benefits and how it can be taught in a fun, engaging way to kids in 1st-8th grade. 
Computer programming is much more than sitting at a computer and writing code – it involves critical thinking, creative expression, storytelling, and quite a bit of fun.  
Meet instructors, see sample class demos, and kids get to play games that are created in the classes (Modding Minecraft, Scratch, Kodu, etc). Come learn more about coding and how your child can benefit from learning technology skills especially when they are in 1st-8th grade.

name.text: Save The Village - Walking Tour
name.html: Save The Village - Walking Tour

description.text:
SAVE THE VILLAGE 
The original tour featuring the photos of Fred W. McDarrah. Based on a blockbuster photo exhibit of the same name that was on display at the Steven Kasher Gallery in Chelsea in 2014. So many individuals and groups came to the show, and there was such a positive media reaction to the exhibition and gallery workers were peppered on a daily basis with so many questions about the photos and the changing face of Greenwich Village....  
The exhibition ended, but the interest in Greenwich Village in the 1960s and McDarrah's documentation of the changing scene did not wane one iota. So the Estate of Fred W. McDarrah decided to bring the people not to the gallery, but to the scenes that made the show such a success: the Greenwich Village locales documented by McDarrah during his tenure at the Village Voice – such as Washington Square Park; the Stonewall Inn, the birthplace of the modern day gay rights movement; and the various stomping grounds of the individuals he photographed that helped shape the 1960s ethos, including Bob Dylan, Andy Warhol and Jimi Hendrix. 
  
TOUR GROUP LEAVES FROM CHRISTOPHER PARK 
AT the STONEWALL PL. ENTRANCE 
  
(Across from Kettle of fish bar) 
  
  
  
PLEASE ARRIVE 10 MINUTES before scheduled time 
Contact info@savethevillagetours.com for group discounts 
  
WALKING TOURS THROUGH THE PHOTOGRAPHS OF FRED W. MCDARRAH 
Greenwhich Village walking tours like no other! See where history was recorded by the original Village Voice photographer Fred W. McDarrah - the most curious, knowledgeable and defatigable chronicler of the New York downtown scene over the second half of the 20th century! Before the Internet, there was McDarrah. He captured all of the artsts, writers, musicians and social movements that marked the time.  
Each guest recieves a keepsake multi-postcard set of classic McDarrah images and the tours go to the same locations to see how they have changed, how they are the same, and to hear the stories behind the famous photos. 
  
WWW.SAVETHEVILLAGETOURS.COM
description.html:
SAVE THE VILLAGE

The original tour featuring the photos of Fred W. McDarrah. Based on a blockbuster photo exhibit of the same name that was on display at the Steven Kasher Gallery in Chelsea in 2014. So many individuals and groups came to the show, and there was such a positive media reaction to the exhibition and gallery workers were peppered on a daily basis with so many questions about the photos and the changing face of Greenwich Village.... 

The exhibition ended, but the interest in Greenwich Village in the 1960s and McDarrah's documentation of the changing scene did not wane one iota. So the Estate of Fred W. McDarrah decided to bring the people not to the gallery, but to the scenes that made the show such a success: the Greenwich Village locales documented by McDarrah during his tenure at the Village Voice – such as Washington Square Park; the Stonewall Inn, the birthplace of the modern day gay rights movement; and the various stomping grounds of the individuals he photographed that helped shape the 1960s ethos, including Bob Dylan, Andy Warhol and Jimi Hendrix.

 

TOUR GROUP LEAVES FROM CHRISTOPHER PARK

AT the STONEWALL PL. ENTRANCE

 

(Across from Kettle of fish bar)

 



PLEASE ARRIVE 10 MINUTES before scheduled time

Contact info@savethevillagetours.com for group discounts

 

WALKING TOURS THROUGH THE PHOTOGRAPHS OF FRED W. MCDARRAH

Greenwhich Village walking tours like no other! See where history was recorded by the original Village Voice photographer Fred W. McDarrah - the most curious, knowledgeable and defatigable chronicler of the New York downtown scene over the second half of the 20th century! Before the Internet, there was McDarrah. He captured all of the artsts, writers, musicians and social movements that marked the time.

Each guest recieves a keepsake multi-postcard set of classic McDarrah images and the tours go to the same locations to see how they have changed, how they are the same, and to hear the stories behind the famous photos.

 

WWW.SAVETHEVILLAGETOURS.COM

name.text: Figure Drawing Class
name.html: Figure Drawing Class

description.text:
Have you always wanted to learn to draw or develop your childhood skills? We are offering you a confidence enhancing drawing class, suitable for beginners and those who feel a little bit set in their way of drawing. This is great one-off  class to join. 
Not only the live model will pose for the class, but also the students are highly encouraged to pose for better understanding of figure drawing, and for fun. Students will learn to draw variety of poses where they will aim for strong gesture and draftsmanship. Poses will be relatively short, to focus on capturing the movements and fundamental construction of the figure, and understanding the abstract rhythms that make the figure such an important and captivating subject. There will be constant demonstrations as well as critiques. 
We plan for a small class setting with a maximum of 10 students. 
All basic materials will be provided but you are welcome to bring materials of your choice if you so wish.

The East Village has the greatest diversity of cultures concentrated in one area in all of New York City. Ethnic groups residing in the area include Japanese, Indian, Jewish, and Ukrainian. Within walking distance, you can have the best ethnic foods and drinks of the City, experience the tastes of the world, and discover the history, culture, and development of a historic neighborhood. 
Your food and drinks tasting journey includes delicious tastings of the following: 

Beers and a Cheese Plate: Served from the oldest bar in NYC. The only bar that can claim Abraham Lincoln had been there before.

Chinese Liangpi Noodles: a dish of cold noodles with vegetables and spongy gluten in a sauce that hits every possible flavor category (e.g. savory, tangy, and sweet). name.text: JEWISH FOOD TOUR OF NEW YORK
name.html: JEWISH FOOD TOUR OF NEW YORK

description.text:
At the turn of the 20th century, when the Lower East Side was the most densely populated place in the world, the vast majority of the district's 550,000 residents were Jewish. The Lower East Side was the first port of call for millions of Jews fleeing persecution in Eastern Europe. Over a century later, we set off to explore the ancestral gateway to America through the diverse cooking traditions of the Jewish diaspora, and through the food discover the history and cultural legacy of Jewish culture in New York. Did Jews become assimilated to New York, or the other way around: New York assimilated to the Jews! Comedian Lenny Bruce declared: “It doesn’t matter, even if you’re Catholic. If you live in New York, you’re Jewish. If you live in Butte, Montana, you are going to be goyish if you’re Jewish.” 
  
Capacity: 25 persons per guide 
Note: All food is included. 5 tastings on the go (sidewalk tastings, or done inside the establishments). 
Meeting Location: 2nd Ave & E Houston St 
Final Destination: Eldridge St 
  
JEWISH FOOD TOUR OF NEW YORK 
Jewish Cuisine: Bagels and lox, Knish, Matzo, Bialy, and much more! 
Jewish History in NYC: Did you know the first significant group of Jews to come to New York, then the colony New Amsterdam, came in September 1654 as refugees from Recife, Brazil? 
Famous Jewish New Yorkers: Edward Koch, Woody Allen, Estee Lauder, and many more! 
Aside from the food and culture, there is much more to experience on the tour, from street art to hipster watching, and the charm of the LES, there are many more hidden stories and secrets in store on this cultural dive into the LES. 
  
Important Details: 
Tour Schedules: This is a weekly event 
Sundays: 12:00 PM – 02:00 PM 
Price: $50.00 per person excluding tax. 
Event URL:http://besttours.com/jewish-food-tour-of-new-york.html 
Event email: support@besttours.com 
Contact number: 212-796-4200

name.text: Introductory Ceramics Workshop
name.html: Introductory Ceramics Workshop

description.text:
If you always wanted to roll up your sleeves to have some fun working with clay, this is your opportunity. We are offering a 2.5 hour Introduction hand-building workshop with Tribeca Clayworks at the Downtown Community Center. 
In our fully equipped ceramic studio (pottery wheels, kilns, clay extruder, slab roller, all the tools you need and lots of clay), you will be instructed by our professional ceramic artists. On a Tuesday evening (6:30-9pm) or a Sunday afternoon (12-2:30) you will learn many of the hand-building skills that’s needed to make all kinds of functional and sculptural works of art. 
If you want to keep your work you can glaze your ware (during the session) and for $15 we will fire it in our kiln. 
At the end of the class you can take a spin on the pottery wheel. Just be prepared to get dirty!!! 
TO MAKE YOUR RESERVATION: ON VOUCHER THERE IS A LINK TO EVENTBRITE, WHERE IT ASKS FOR PROMO CODE PUT IN YOUR VOUCHER NUMBER.

Vietnamese Sandwich: Ultimate favorite of many Food Network stars

Northern Chinese Dumplings

description.text:

This Chinatown tour takes you to secret eateries, restaurants, and specialty shops – the authentic Chinese way! A Chinese local guide will expose you to a wide variety of Chinese regional cultures including those of the Taiwanese, Shanghais, Pekingese, Cantonese, and Hongkonger. It will be an eye-opening and mouth-watering experience!  
Your food-tasting journey allows you to savor the following gastronomic delights: 

Cantonese BBQ including roasted duck and pork: crisp and juicy (a sit-down dining experience)
Authentic Chinese Wontan Soup: thin wontan skin with generous fillings of shrimps and pork (a sit-down dining experience)
Dim Sum Pastry: pick from a variety (e.g. roasted pork bun, or fried sesame ball)
Asian Beef Jerky: mouth-watering; softer and sweeter than the American style
Taiwanese Teas: from the most well-known and popular tea house in Asia
Shanghais Scallion Pancake: a light and crisp, delicious snack

name.html: Asian Vegetarian Food & Culture Tour™ $64 (w/ Dim Sum)

description.text:
Are you curious which country originated Tofu? What does authentic soy milk taste like? Is there vegetarian dim sum available? What is the art of making Asian tea? What are the essential elements of Asian Vegetarian Cuisines? Our Original Asian Vegetarian Food and Culture Walking Tour will take you to NYC Chinatown to experience Buddhist Cuisine, also known as East Asian vegetarian cuisine (zhāicài), one of the oldest known vegetarian cuisines! You will have all your questions about Asian Vegetarian Cuisine answered! You will also learn about the history and culture of Chinatown. 
Your food and culture journey includes the following: 

Dim Sum (which literally means "touch of the heart"): Scrumptious small portion dishes - traditionally served family style
Local tofu shop: Taste authentic tofu products
A variety of Chinese Teas: From the most well-known and popular Taiwanese tea house in Asia
Shanghais Scallion Pancake: A light and crisp, delicious snack
Vietnamese Sandwich: The favorite sandwich among Food Network celebrities 
*(Optional) A variety of exotic Asian flavored ice-cream
A variety of Chinese pastries
Hongkonger popular snacks

If you want to have a unique and delicious vegetarian experience, join us today. All tastings and dining are included in your ticket price of $64 (all fees are included). 
Go to http://foodtoursofny.com for more information.

name.text: Freakiest & Funniest Food Tour™ $65
name.html: Freakiest & Funniest Food Tour™ $65

description.text:
Are you ready for an exotic, adventurous, freaky, funny, and yet delicious food tour? You are going to explore a wide variety of foods that you have never thought of tasting before. Some of you may have never even heard of these foods! They are, however, the favorite foods of millions of people worldwide! Aren’t you curious about why others love these foods so much? Is it because of their taste or nutritional benefits? Are you daring enough to explore them yourself?  Do you want to see your friends, family, or fellow tourists’ funky facial expressions as they try new exotic foods? Furthermore, we are going to have a little food eating competition and give a prize to the fastest chicken foot eater!  
Here is your freaky food list:  
1.      Durian - “king of fruits,” the size of a basketball with a unique odor that people either love or hate, and formidable thorn-covered husk; its flesh tastes like a rich custard, highly flavored with almonds! 
2.      A variety of Asian snacks including dried fish, squid, super wasabi nuts, and preserved plums which are sweet, sour, and salty all at the same time. 
3.   Chicken feet with black bean sauce - light, moist, & tender; a must dim sum dish for Chinese people. 
4.      Rice with pig feet – soft and smooth! 
5.      Noodle soup with beef tendon stew – tender and chewy! 
6.   Congee with Thousand-year-old egg – Not actually a thousand years old, but fermented for a week or even a month.  The yolk is dark green & creamy and  the white is dark brown & like jelly. 
7.   Tofu Brain - The popular Chinese traditional dessert!  
You are also going to visit:   

a meat market where you can find crocodile legs
a Chinese herbal shop where you will see a bunch of rare dried seafood including sea cucumbers, seahorses, and shark fins.

This freaky tour is not only about food tastings but also about having a hilarious time with your friends, family and/or fellow tourists. Come join us today for an adventurous food tour for only $65. All tastings are included.  
Go to http://foodtoursofny.com for more information.

description.text:
We know how important food is to New Yorkers, and this 2 hour walking tour brings the New York 'classics' together so you can taste the real New York. Discover the best eateries in the West Village as we wander through the tree lined streets sampling the finest ingredients from specialty shops, bakeries, and delicatessens.

name.text: PIZZA TOUR OF NEW YORK
name.html: PIZZA TOUR OF NEW YORK

description.text:
If there's one food that says "New York", it's pizza. Whether you're meeting friends out for a pie, grabbing a slice on the go, or ordering in for a late night snack, pizza is one of the few things that will never let you down. Explore downtown Manhattan, learn about its rich cultural history, and taste four of the best slices the city has to offer on The Great New York Pizza Tour! 
Capacity: 20 people per guide 
Note: All food is uncluded. 4 slices on the go (sidewalk tastings, or done inside the establishments). 
Dress: It’s a walking tour so wear comfortable shoes and clothing. 
Final Destination: Bleecker St Pizza 
Great New York Pizza Tour Itinerary 

Prince St. PizzaThe site of the Original Ray's Pizza, Prince St.'s delicious "SoHo Square" is one of downtown's best kept culinary secrets...until now... 
SusannaTheir original two locations are in Verona and Mantova. You won't find a more authentic Italian slice this side of the Atlantic.
Lombardi's Pizza America's oldest pizzeria! Their 106 year old coal oven still impresses locals, tourists, and international foodies alike
Bleecker St. PizzaTheir Tuscan style slice was named the Best Pizza in NYC by Food Network...3 years in a row!
While you walk off your slices, explore film locations, historic sites, and modern cultural landmarks on this delicious, fun-filled stroll around downtown Manhattan.

name.text: BROOKLYN FOOD TOUR
name.html: BROOKLYN FOOD TOUR

description.text:
Ever wonder how Brooklyn’s hipsters fit into their 29-inch waisted skinny jeans? Prepare to wonder even more...because after this two hour tour of Williamsburg’s trendiest artisanal eateries, your own pants may become an inch too small. From wood-fired pizza and down home country barbecue to Brooklyn-made wine and walnut brittle, prepare for the hippest food tasting tour on the East Coast! (American Spirits and PBR not included!) 
  
Capacity: 20 persons per guide 
Dress: It's a walking tour so dress comfortably! 
Departs: In front of the South Entrance to the Bedford Ave L Train Stop 
Final destination: Oddfellows Ice Cream, 175 Kent Ave 
  
Brooklyn Food Tour Itinerary: 
  

Fornino Since opening in 2004, Fornino’s wood-fired pizzas have racked up several awards, including 2007’s best pizza in NYC!
Handsome Dan Browse Dan’s wild selection of desserts and candies that scream 'only in Williamsburg', while you munch on some homemade Kings County Walnut Brittle.
Mable's Smokehouse Husband and wife owners from Oklahoma and Kentucky built every chair, table and barstool in the place. If you’re impressed with their woodwork, wait ‘til you try their ribs.
OddFellows Ice Cream Celebrating it's one year anniversary this summer, OddFellows' made-from-scratch ice cream has already been named the best in NYC!
Bagelsmith This bagel shop bakes on premises, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Sundried Tomato-Basil Tofu Cream Cheese anyone?
Mast Brothers New York's only bean to bar chocolate maker, the expert Mast siblings make superb artisanal chocolate from scratch, roasting and grinding single source cacao beans right here in Williamsburg!
Aside from the food, there is much more to experience on the tour, from street art to hipster watching, and the stunning view of Manhattan, there are many more hidden stories and secrets in store on this cultural dive into Williamsburg.

name.text: Los Columpios (The Swings)
name.html: Los Columpios (The Swings)

description.text:
IATI Theater presents a story of a man and a woman avoiding what they must do: talk about themselves; presented in Spanish with English supertitles. 
A man and a woman meet in a playground. What might seem like a chance meeting soon becomes fragmented dialogue of two people who know one another too well and who fear getting hurt. So they talk about everything and nothing in particular, anything to avoid talking about themselves or each other. 'Los Columpios' is an absurdist tragicomedy that delves into romantic relationships from a different perspective.

name.text: Classical Piano at Caffe Vivaldi
name.html: Classical Piano at Caffe Vivaldi

description.text:
Pianist Emir GAMSIZOGLU, known with his nickname "Chatty Pianist" continues his "Classical for All" concert series in New York's legendary Caffe Vivaldi.  
Since its opening in the 80's, Caffe Vivaldi embodies an Old New York.  
Pianist/composer Emir GAMSIZOGLU's concerts attracts audiences from all ages and backgrounds with its friendly and casual atmosphere. You will get to witness the performance of a virtuoso pianist only a couple feet away from you, while sipping your wine and then hear him talk about the pieces he performs.  
Check out Classical for All concerts on Manhattan media;

name.text: Dive into DaDa: Canvas Collage Class
name.html: Dive into DaDa: Canvas Collage Class

description.text:
In this class you will learn: 
- Basic color theory - The history and artistic significance of the DADA movement - How to visually solve the problems  - Critique & Feedback 
Final Product: Your very own painting of artistic anarchy on a physical canvas! 
In-Class: To remove the self from art, the instructor Young Sun will guide students through a set of instructions to make the most out of random chance. Through this class, students will learn how to take advantage of each situation, making the decisions they can between the restrictions. Students will walk away with a collage media form as a final piece that reflects their artistic persona. 
What is DADA? : 
DADA is the reason why Marcel Duchamp’s “Urinal” was a big deal. For those who are unfamiliar with this, Duchamp turned a urinal upside down and signed it. Then he became a significant figure in art history. 
DADA was a form of artistic anarchy, challenging the existing values in the society. Many different forms of contemporary arts (such as theatre, painting and music) were part of this movement. 
Classes will take place in a small classroom setting with an estimated attendance of 10 per class. 
 Instructor: Young Sun Song is a freelance jewelry designer and an art teacher at Fusion Academy. She graduated from Pratt Institute with B.F.A in Jewelry Design. As an artist and educator, reinvention and continuous improvement are both constants in her life. youngsunsong.com

name.text: Twelfth Night: A Shakespearean Comedy by OFFLINE PRODUCTIONS
name.html: Twelfth Night: A Shakespearean Comedy by OFFLINE PRODUCTIONS

description.text:
New York, NY: Offline Productions, working with the People’s Improv Theater and Director Alexis Confer, is proud to announce its upcoming production of Twelfth Night. One of Shakespeare's most renowned comedies, Twelfth Night is a timeless examination of love in its various forms – romantic love, familial love, love of self, etc. It is also a timely commentary on the transformative power that such love exercises on identity and status. 
  
This production will use the classic language of Shakespeare in the modern setting of the tropical resort Illyria, owned by the mourning Olivia, and frequented by the likes of Orsino, a competitive surfer, and Sir Toby Belch, a freeloading uncle.  
  
This uniquely funny rendition will feature some of NYC's finest actors, improvisers, stand up comedians and musical performers.  
  
For tickets please visit www.offlinenyc.com 
  
***Special Discounts for Students and Groups***
